title: Copywriter (HUB) - Ogilvy Philippines
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
The Copywriter will contribute to the company by creating impactful advertising campaigns, driving client satisfaction, and positively influencing the overall success of the organization. Their experience, creativity, and ability to communicate effectively will make them a valuable asset to the organization and help us continue to grow and excel in the competitive advertising landscape.
What You’ll Do 

Collaborate with the social team to develop and produce high-quality, engaging content for various advertising mediums, both digital and social media.
Generate creative ideas and concepts that align with the client's brand and marketing objectives.
Write and edit clear, compelling copy for a variety of mediums, ensuring consistency in tone, style, and messaging.
Work closely with account managers, designers, and other team members to ensure creative concepts are executed effectively and delivered on time.
Regularly present and sell creative ideas to clients and internal stakeholders.
Stay up to date on industry trends, best practices, and competitive landscape to ensure our clients' advertising campaigns remain innovative and effective.
Assist in setting project scope, timelines, and objectives, and ensure these are met within budget constraints.

What You’ll Need  

Bachelor's degree in advertising, Design &Communications, Journalism, Writing or a related field.
A minimum of 4-6 years of professional copywriting experience, preferably in the advertising or marketing industry.
Good portfolio showcasing a diverse range of successful campaigns and examples of compelling, creative copy.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a strong command of the English and Mandarin language. Allowing the company to create advertising campaigns that resonate with diverse audiences both locally and internationally. This will enable them to understand cultural nuances and craft messages that are more effective in reaching target customers.
Knowledge of various advertising mediums and best practices for copywriting within each.
The candidate may have unique expertise in particular niche markets or industries, allowing them to create targeted advertising campaigns with specialized knowledge.
Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
Collaborative mindset and team player, with experience working closely with designers, account managers, and other creative professionals. The candidate's diverse background and experiences have taught them to excel in collaborative, fast-paced environments. They possess exceptional interpersonal skills and are adept at working with team members from various cultural backgrounds. This adaptability will enable the company to develop cohesive and effective advertising campaigns across its diverse teams.
Commitment to staying current with industry trends and incorporating new ideas into client work.

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
